page.title: 19LOCAL HISTORY & POPULATION
page.content:
LOCAL HISTORY
Our village lies at 250ft above sea level.The Palace was used as a hunting lodge during the Stuart period by the knights and squires who resided at Newton, which is where the ale used in Falkland was brewed.Falconry and boar hunting were very popular when Royalty came to the palace.The name of our village comes from this pastime which was carried out in the vast forests which then surrounded the village.
POPULATION
The population of the total area of our section is about 2,000 persons. There is a sizeable portion of elderly people young people are in the minority.The village contains a mainly middle aged and stable population.
